interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Art and Science of Staff Fighting 2-DVD (YMAA DVD) Joe Varady step by step Staff, Nine Levels - Easy to Expert **NEW BESTSELLER**
Review Date: 2022/07/29
Store: Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['SALE! Marked down from full price of $99.95! NINE LEVELS, EASY TO EXPERT', 'The 8-hour Art and Science of Staff Fighting video offers complete step by step instruction for the staff, with an emphasis on the dynamics of combat. The author draws on thirty years of martial experience, presenting the best of both Eastern and Western traditions.', 'Joe Varady lays out a comprehensive course of study in nine levels, from beginner to expert, guiding you through such fundamentals as stances, striking, blocking, and footwork. In advanced lessons, viewers learn disarming techniques, groundwork, and facing multiple opponents.', 'This video is not just for staff enthusiasts. Even those unfamiliar with martial arts can adapt these techniques, increasing their skill and confidence in defending themselves.', '"Our environment is usually full of improvised weapons,” says Varady. “Staff fighting techniques can be effectively applied in a self-defense situation using a walking stick, coatrack, curtain rod, floor lamp, hockey stick, fallen tree branch, broom, mop, shovel, or rake.”', 'This video features:', 'Nine levels, progressing from easy to expert Detailed step by step instructions, drills, fundamentals, and advanced techniques A “nondenominational” approach to staff, utilizing the best of Eastern and Western arts A comprehensive, methodical approach to building staff skills', 'If you are already a student of the staff, these lessons will augment your techniques, broaden your options, and offer foundational insights to other polearms such as the spear and halberd. Whether you are an experienced staff fighter or a layman seeking practical techniques for self-defense, The Art and Science of Staff Fighting will help you develop the skills you need.']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Exercise & Fitness, Action & Adventure, Sports', 'Format': 'DVD', 'Runtime': '8 hours', 'Studio': 'YMAA Publication Center', 'Package Dimensions': '7.6 x 5.39 x 0.67 inches; 4.97 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'DVD', 'Run time': '8 hours', 'Country of Origin': 'USA'}
Review Text: The instruction on these videos is easy to follow and is accessible to raw beginners wanting to try something new. This has a cool mix of martial arts, upper body strength training, and special effects/stunt fighting. Whether you like LARPing and cosplaying or are interested in self defense or martial arts, this is a great at-home workout for all levels and most ages, and you can get pretty decent at it by the end (with practice. Suggestion: start with a foam staff so it doesn’t hurt when you hit yourself. Fun!
Review Title: Fun and easy to follow
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Charlie and the Chocolate Factory Johnny Depp (Actor), Freddie Highmore (Actor), Tim Burton (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles ['Product Description', "Willy Wonka, the eccentric owner of a candy factory, decides to open up his factory to five lucky kids who won a contest by finding golden tickets in his candy bars. As the tour progresses, each kid succumbs to a temptation of their weaknesses except for Charlie Bucket, an innocent child whose family has grown up in poverty in the shadow Willy Wonka's monstrous factory.", 'Amazon.com', "Mixed reviews and creepy comparisons to Michael Jackson notwithstanding, Tim Burton's splendidly imaginative adaptation of", 'Charlie and the Chocolate Factory', "would almost surely meet with Roald Dahl's approval. The celebrated author of darkly offbeat children's books vehemently disapproved of 1971's", 'Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory', "(hence the change in title), so it's only fitting that Burton and his frequent star/collaborator, Johnny Depp, should have another go, infusing the enigmatic candyman's tale with their own unique brand of imaginative oddity. Depp's pale, androgynous Wonka led some to suspect a partial riff on that most controversial of eternal children, Michael Jackson, but Burton's film is too expansively magnificent to be so narrowly defined. While preserving Dahl's morality tale on the hazards of indulgent excess, Burton's riotous explosion of color provides a wondrous setting for the lessons learned by Charlie Bucket (played by Freddie Highmore, Depp's delightful costar in", 'Finding Neverland', "), as he and other, less admirable children enjoy a once-in-a-lifetime tour of Wonka's confectionary wonderland. Elaborate visual effects make this an eye-candy overdose (including digitally multiplied Oompa-Loompas, all played by diminutive actor Deep Roy), and the film's underlying weirdness is exaggerated by Depp's admirably risky but ultimately off-putting performance. Of course, none of this stops Burton's Charlie from being the must-own family DVD of 2005's holiday season, perhaps even for those who staunchly defend Gene Wilder's portrayal of Wonka from 34 years earlier.", '--Jeff Shannon', 'DVD features', 'The second disc is filled with a number of distinctive featurettes. The likely crowd-pleaser in most households is "Attack of the Squirrels," which recounts how those fuzzy little creatures (a combination of hard-to-train live animals, animatronics, and computer graphics) can be ornery in their own right. "The Fantastic Mr. Dahl" is a 17-minute look at author Roald Dahl through vintage footage and new interviews with family, friends, and colleagues. "Becoming Oompa-Loompa" follows Deep Roy as he is filmed over and over again through his dance steps and music performances.', 'Roy is a constant throughout the kids\' activities as well. You can follow him to learn two different dance steps "Augustus Gloop" and "Violet Beauregarde," and make him taste weird candy inventions in a simple game. "Search for the Golden Ticket" is a five-part challenge that tests your remote-control fingers, your deductive abilities, or your luck. Finally, if you just want basic behind-the-scenes information, "Making the Mix" is a collection of featurettes (around 40 minutes total) covering the film\'s casting, music, production design, and special effects.', '--David Horiuchi'] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 5.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '12569743151', 'Director': 'Tim Burton', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, Closed-captioned, Full Screen, NTSC, Dubbed, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 8, 2005', 'Actors': 'Johnny Depp, Freddie Highmore, David Kelly, Helena Bonham Carter, Noah Taylor', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Brad Grey, Bruce Berman, Derek Frey, Graham Burke, Katterli Frauenfelder', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1 EX), French (Dolby Digital 5.1 EX), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1 EX)', 'Studio': 'Warner Bros. Pictures', 'Writers': 'John August, Roald Dahl', 'Number of discs': '2'} The newest adaptation is nothing like the book; if anything, try the Gene Wilder one, which better captures the fun-loving nature of Wonka and the silly laughs resulting from the rotten kids visiting the delicious funhouse. That screenplay, as it happens, was written by Dahl, so you know it is true to his intentions. That, and the music is more fun and catchy, whereas this one fails to impress.

The visuals are typical for Tim Burton: beautifully dark, twisted, and a little scary. The humor is there at times, but is overshadowed by the overwhelming artistic vision and really unpleasant version of the oompa loompas. The various elements are mostly exciting, but don't quite add up to an engaging film. Nice try, but not the best. not as good as the Gene Wilder version Matilda (Special Edition) Mara Wilson (Actor), Danny DeVito (Actor, Director, Producer) Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles ["See the world from a kid's-eye view with MATILDA, a modern fairytale that mixes hilarious humor with the magical message of love. Mrs. Doubtfire's Mara Wilson stars as Matilda, a super-smart little girl who's woefully misunderstood by her parents (Danny DeVito and Rhea Perlman), her brother, and anevil school principal. But with the help of a brave best friend and a wonderful teacher, Matilda discovers she doesn't have to get mad to get even. 2013 BD Release: From best-selling author Roald Dahl and the unique vision of Danny DeVito comes Matilda, remastered in high definition! This modern-day fairy tale mixes hilarious humor with a magical message of love. Mrs. Doubtfire’s Mara Wilson stars as Matilda, a super-smart little girl who’s woefully misunderstood by her parents (Danny DeVito and Rhea Perlman), her brother and an evil school principal. But with the help of a brave best friend and a wonderful teacher, Matilda discovers she doesn’t have to get mad to get even. 2016 Refresh Fro"] {'Genre': 'Family, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, AC-3, Full Screen, NTSC, Dubbed, Subtitled, Special Edition', 'Contributor': 'Stacey Sher, Mara Wilson, Danny DeVito, Embeth Davidtz, Pam Ferris, Michael Shamberg, Liccy Dahl, Rhea Perlman, Matilda Productions (TriStar)Stacey Sher, Mara Wilson, Danny DeVito, Embeth Davidtz, Pam Ferris, Michael Shamberg, Liccy Dahl, Rhea Perlman, Matilda Productions (TriStar) See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 38 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 5.3 x 7.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'Relay Time: 98 min', 'Director': 'Danny DeVito', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, AC-3, Full Screen, NTSC, Dubbed, Subtitled, Special Edition', 'Run time': '1 hour and 38 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 17, 2006', 'Actors': 'Mara Wilson, Danny DeVito, Rhea Perlman, Embeth Davidtz, Pam Ferris', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Stacey Sher, Liccy Dahl, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} This is a great story about a brilliant young girl who overcomes the cruelty of a family that does not treat her as she deserves. The villains are her parents and her teacher, Mrs Trunchbull. With the help of the kind teacher, Ms Honey, and her own magical powers, she manages to get adopted by her mentor and get rid of the villainous teacher who killed Ms Honey's parents. Not only does the book make some interesting statements about education and family, but the strong female protagonist is a neat role model for young girls. I loved it as a kid, and still appreciate it a great deal; also, the film version captures the imagery and intent nicely.

As for the widescreen issue, it's a shame. It could have been kept the way we saw it in theatres...oh well. Great adaptation! Paper Heart Charlyne Yi (Actor, Composer), Michael Cera (Actor, Composer), Nicholas Jasenovec (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy ['Product Description', "Charlyne Yi embarks on a quest across America to make a documentary about the one subject she doesn't fully understand: Love.", 'Amazon.com', 'A creatively self-conscious comedy that is part real documentary and part, well, something else,', 'Paper Heart', "begins as an inquiry by artist and comedian Charlyne Yi into the nature of love. Working closely with pal and director Nicholas Jasenovec, Yi travels the U.S. looking for anyone who will talk to her about their experiences with or perspectives about love. Along the way, she meets some wonderful people, including older folks, children, and even a celebrity (Seth Rogen) or two. But nothing shakes Yi's skepticism that there is such a thing as permanent, romantic love until actor Michael Cera (", 'Juno', ") stumbles into her on-camera life. Shy but curious about one another, Cera and Yi cautiously hook up, troubled by the omnipresence of Jasenovec and his crew but unable to get free of Yi's agreement to allow everything to be filmed. The very pressure under which they try to make their simmering relationship work becomes the test Yi needs to believe that love is real--or, at least, cleverly scripted. It's hard to know exactly where the line is between documentary and fiction in this film, but in a way it doesn't matter. A point or two is made, and the audience gets to enjoy Yi's cardboard-cutout puppetry.", '--Tom Keogh', 'Stills from', 'Paper Heart', '(Click for larger image)'] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.63 x 5.4 x 7.65 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '6540672', 'Director': 'Nicholas Jasenovec', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 28 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 29, 2010', 'Actors': 'Charlyne Yi, Michael Cera, Seth Rogen, Martin Starr, Derek Waters', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Number of discs': '1'} This is an indie mockumentary about love with some amazing performers and a very naturalistic script. The pace is a little slow for my taste, and it's not my favorite genre of movie, but I appreciated it for what it was. Considering it should fall away from the beaten path of Hollywood romances, it does come across as a little trite at times, with the obvious love interest between Charlyne Yi and Michael Sera. Still, it is endearing and ok for a low-key evening. if you like this kind of movie, then this is good Element: Targeted Toning Pilates for Beginners Elizabeth Ordway (Actor), Andrea Ambandos (Director) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Exercise & Fitness ['Filmed in a lush garden overlooking the Pacific Ocean, these three powerful 20-minute programs are designed to reach even the hardest to access muscles-which is the key to creating a slim, balanced body and achieving dramatic results. The Long Lean Waistline program stretches and tones your core muscles simultaneously to create firm, flat abs and sculpted waistline. The Lower Body Lift and Sculpt workout uses a dynamic leg series and focused "seat lifters" to shape and firm the entire lower half of the body. The efficient Total Body program tones and defines all of the major muscle groups in just 20 minutes for maximum full-body benefits. As a bonus, this DVD includes a 10-minute core strengthener featuring signature moves to tighten your midsection and create beautiful curves along your waistline. Each of these specially-designed programs utilizes the dynamic of working in opposition to create long, lean muscles and sculpt a strong and graceful Pilates physique.'] {'Genre': 'Fitness', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Elizabeth Ordway, Andrea Ambandos', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '27576233', 'Director': 'Andrea Ambandos', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 19 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 1, 2013', 'Actors': 'Elizabeth Ordway', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Number of discs': '1'} I wasn't sure what to expect from this beyond some yoga-like movements that might trim some fat and build muscle, but I really liked this DVD. I am a dancer and have a once-a-week personal trainer, so I am in pretty good shape, but I don't stretch as much as I should, and my back, glutes, and legs can sometimes get a little messed up from overworking without warming up. This DVD was perfect for me because, while the "exercise" component wasn't really there for me (very easy), the movements had a therapeutic quality to them.

The instructor actually did a great job explaining pilates both conceptually and in terms of how different movements could achieve different results. The demonstration of those movements was clear and easy to follow, as well, so there was no getting lost and feeling silly the way that some workout videos can do.

Don't expect some crazy cardio-burning workout with high intensity movements. This is a Beginner's DVD that shows some basic pilates movements and will help Start your muscles moving and stretching. Good stuff! feel-good, low-impact activity; great for beginners! {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Ελληνικά', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Joey Soloway', 'Andrea Arnold', 'Nisha Ganatra', 'Silas Howard', 'Jim Frohna', 'Stacie Passon', 'Marta Cunningham', 'Allison Liddi-Brown', 'Marielle Heller', 'So Yong Kim'], 'Producers': ['Joey Soloway', 'Nisha Ganatra', 'Andrea Sperling', 'Victor Hsu', 'Bridget Bedard', 'Rick Rosenthal', 'Jennifer Corey'], 'Starring': ['Jeffrey Tambor', 'Gaby Hoffmann', 'Jay Duplass'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} This show somehow balances sensitivity toward a still-marginalized community with a great sense of humor in a very realistic and balanced way. I am completely addicted and sadly finished the season over the course of two marathons. Impeccable casting, acting, writing, and directing. This is a revolutionary program--keep it up, Amazon! hilarious, sensitive, moving! Crimson Peak Mia Wasikowska (Actor), Jessica Chastain (Actor), Guillermo del Toro (Director, Producer, Writer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ["From the imagination of director Guillermo del Toro (Pan's Labyrinth) comes the gothic romance masterpiece Crimson Peak starring Tom Hiddleston, Jessica Chastain, Mia Wasikowska and Charlie Hunnam. When her heart is stolen by a seductive stranger, a young woman is swept away to a house atop a mountain of blood-red clay—a place filled with secrets that will haunt her forever. Between desire and darkness, between mystery and madness, lies the truth behind Crimson Peak."] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7 x 5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Director': 'Guillermo del Toro', 'Media Format': 'Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Digital_copy', 'Run time': '3 hours and 58 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 9, 2016', 'Actors': 'Mia Wasikowska, Jessica Chastain, Tom Hiddleston, Charlie Hunnam, Jim Beaver', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Producers': 'Thomas Tull, Jon Jashni, Guillermo del Toro, Callum Greene', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French Canadian (Dolby Digital 5.1), French Canadian (DTS 5.1), Spanish (DTS 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Universal', 'Writers': 'Guillermo del Toro, Matthew Robbins', 'Number of discs': '2'} What a masterfully executed throwback to classic gothic horror stories! From the impeccably researched costumes, complete with period details and smartly chosen anachronisms for a decaying family, to the haunting settings, this movie was one of my favorites last year. Excellent storyline, great casting and direction, suspense and mystery, and beautiful effects--this is a perfect movie for fans of classic horror stories! Omg the costumes. Classic horror story in a sumptuous setting Tai Chi Fit for a HEALTHY BACK: Seated Workout (YMAA) David-Dorian Ross **Sitting Tai Chi Bestseller** David-Dorian Ross (Actor), David Silver (Director) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Exercise & Fitness ['Relieve your back pain naturally with this easy program.', 'Back pain is one of the most common problems in the world, often caused by working too hard, or sometimes by not getting enough exercise. Studies show by the age of 65 more than two thirds of the population have suffered from lower back pain at least once, and a great many suffer from it daily. Back pain can make almost everything else in life nearly impossible and can lead to a sedentary lifestyle and depression.', '• Seated chair workout anyone can do!', '• Simple tai chi movements to follow-along', '• Great for seniors or those with back issues', 'Tai Chi master teacher David-Dorian Ross', 'guides you through a seated routine that can be practiced by anyone, at any age or fitness level. With repetition you will experience pain relief, strength and flexibility.', 'These seated tai chi and qigong exercises to stretch and strengthen your back will take pressure off the spine and muscles, so that you can ease into essential postures for alleviating pain and create better structural integrity.', 'These movements are gentle and easy enough that anyone can practice along, even if you haven’t exercised in years! The best news is that there is nothing to “learn” in this program. You won’t have to memorize a complicated routine or keep working to perfect any movement or position. Just follow the class, breathe deeply, and have fun.', 'DVD all regions / Region-free'] {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.52 x 5.39 x 0.67 inches; 3.21 Ounces', 'Director': 'David Silver', 'Media Format': 'DVD', 'Run time': '45 minutes', 'Actors': 'David-Dorian Ross', 'Studio': 'YMAA Publication Center', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Wow! I cannot recommend this DVD enough! I have a foot injury that’s been keeping me down for a while, and I’ve been getting out of shape, and it’s all been rather frustrating. To be able to get back on the horse and have a fitness routine again is amazing. The movements were challenging, yet relaxing. The breath work and mindfulness that came effortlessly from the routine left me feeling loose, relaxed, and alert. As for the instructor, he’s absolutely terrific! What a calm, friendly, open energy. He’s the perfect teacher for Tai chi, and I look forward to my foot feeling better so I can try his other videos. There’s a solid chance I’ll be getting quite a few of these DVDs for my older family members. This is genuinely accessible to all fitness levels, including those with limited lower body mobility or with lower body injuries. A+++!! Accessible fitness for all, excellent instructor, relaxing but challenging Tai Chi Fit for a HEALTHY HEART with David-Dorian Ross (YMAA) Mind/Body Cardio Workout **BESTSELLER** Beginner friendly David-Dorian Ross (Actor), David Silver (Director) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Exercise & Fitness ['SALE! (Reg $30) Strengthen Your Heart, Improve Your Circulation. Harvard Medical School says Tai Chi may be the best exercise for a healthy heart and cardiovascular system.', 'In this program, Tai Chi Master-teacher David-Dorian Ross guides you through a easy follow-along healthy heart workout using the beautiful and gentle movements of Tai Chi.\xa0 \xa0 A healthy heart and circulatory system is so important because that’s how oxygen is delivered throughout your body, and oxygen is the key ingredient to your metabolism. Poor circulation contributes to all kinds of adverse health conditions, like diabetes, arthritis, Alzheimers and stroke. In Tai Chi, it is understood that your blood, oxygen, and energy, or Qi, circulate together and are the basis of your life. Raising your heart rate strengthens the heart, improves your vascular health, and raises your energy.', 'The American College of Sports Medicine says we need 30 minutes of continuous moderate-intensity motion to maintain basic cardiovascular health. Unlike most forms of exercise, Tai Chi movements use every part of your body all at once. This means for every minute you practice Tai Chi exercise, you’re getting as much as four times the activity as in other workouts. And yet, it’s gentle enough that even a beginner of any age or fitness level can develop a healthier heart with Tai Chi. And for an added bonus, you’ll find that Tai Chi improves your mood and raises your spirit.'] {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.52 x 5.43 x 0.55 inches; 3.56 Ounces', 'Director': 'David Silver', 'Media Format': 'DVD', 'Run time': '45 minutes', 'Actors': 'David-Dorian Ross', 'Producers': 'YMAA Publication Center', 'Studio': 'YMAA Publication Center', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} First of all, I thought I was in better shape! This was a much harder workout than I thought it would be. At the same time, because it is so gentle and slow moving, it is accessible to any fitness level, even full on couch potatoes. Your arms will get tired at first, and maybe some of your lower body movements will be smaller, but you’ll get into the flow.

The instructor has a great sense of humor and a lovely energy, and I deeply enjoyed the explanations and names of moves. This is the second DVD of his that I review, and so far, they are both excellent. I think I might be buying some extras for my parents and some older relatives, who I know could really benefit from this. In the meantime, I’m definitely going to keep up with it! It’s a great mindfulness activity, and you just feel alert and relaxed at the same time afterward. Terrific! More of a workout than I expected, but doable for all levels of fitness Tai Chi Fit for Women (YMAA) David-Dorian Ross **NEW BESTSELLER** David-Dorian Ross (Actor), David Silver (Director) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Exercise & Fitness ['Enjoy this fun and easy Tai Chi Class Specifically for Women. Perfect for Moms and the women in your life!', 'When you look at the balance of fitness routines recommended for health and longevity, it turns out that most of them were actually designed for men. They fit men’s personalities, muscle structure and physique. Fitness programs for women have often just been watered down men’s workouts. But', 'women have different needs when it comes to health and fitness. In this program, David-Dorian Ross and female TaijiFit teachers guide you through a Tai Chi workout designed especially for women.', 'Women, more than men, need a workout that both strengthens the bones and calms the immune system. Women are far more susceptible to autoimmune diseases than men, including MS, arthritis, lupus, fibromyalgia and psoriasis. Women are also more at risk for osteoporosis, or thinning bones, as they get older, which in turn affects your hormones.', 'This short Tai Chi routine can be a perfect daily workout for women. It promotes:', 'balance', 'balance', 'coordination', 'coordination', 'strength', 'strength', 'supports the immune system', 'supports the immune system', 'and raises your spirit.', 'and raises your spirit.', 'The best news is that there is nothing to “learn” in this program. You won’t have to memorize a complicated routine or keep working to perfect any movement. Just follow us for fun, and you’ll experience the healing benefits of Tai Chi. All regions / Region-free DVD.'] {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.6 x 5.43 x 0.63 inches; 3.63 Ounces', 'Director': 'David Silver', 'Run time': '45 minutes', 'Actors': 'David-Dorian Ross', 'Producers': 'YMAA Publication Center', 'Studio': 'YMAA Publication Center', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} I have a few other DVDs by the same instructor, and I absolutely love his energy, explanations, and the general flow of the class. This one was a little different than some of the others in that he had two different individuals (both women) stand in the center to do a section, which was cool, because you get to see how it looks on different bodies. He did the opening and closing sequences, or about half of the class. (He is still in the background doing them with the other two, so you can always refer to anyone in the group.)
I appreciate his approach to Tai Chi, which is lighthearted, with plenty of laughter, and with 40 years of experience and love for the art. The gentle movements are accessible to people of any fitness level, yet they provide a good work out that helps create a sense of balance, peace, and clarity. I highly recommend this DVD! Excellent instructor, wonderful DVD {'Content advisory': ['Flashing lights', 'nudity', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Alex Rudzinski'], 'Producers': ['Robyn Rihanna Fenty', 'Laurence "Jay" Brown', 'Jennifer Rosales Davis', 'Michael Antinoro', 'David Chamberlin', 'Izzie Pick Ibarra', 'Chris Wagner'], 'Starring': ['Rihanna', 'Nas', 'Daddy Yankee']} I feel like a lot of the negative reviews are coming from people who can’t get a grip on the fact that diversity is awesome, and that beautiful comes in every shape, size, race, and gender.
Amazing choreographies, wonderfully inclusive, so so sexy. This is an amazing show. Amazing choreographies, wonderfully inclusive, so so sexy Tai Chi A.M. Workout DVD - Beginner-friendly Tai Chi DVD Gentle Exercise for Energy, Strength and Balance **Tai Chi Bestseller!** Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Exercise & Fitness ['Amazing SALE on this Tai Chi Bestseller! Energize your body and mind with Sunrise Tai Chi.', 'Let the sun shine in! Master-teacher Ramel Rones gently guides you through the morning with a series of powerful mind/body exercises that awaken the senses, stimulate the mind, and fill your body and spirit with abundant energy. The simplified, short Yang-style Sunrise Tai Chi sequence is practiced to both the left and right to help you develop symmetry and balance. Tai chi chuan has been known for centuries to promote deep relaxation, excellent health, and to prevent injuries and illness. These easy movements will: stretch and strengthen your body, and improve your circulation of oxygen and qi energy. The program also teaches you to find balance between strength and flexibility, increase bone density, and massage the internal organs, improving your quality of life and daily physical performance.', 'Select your choice of short, medium, or long workouts and choice of music. Revitalize your health and well being with mind/body exercise, meditation, stretching, and strengthening. Tai chi, qigong, and yoga together in a holistic workout.', 'This tai chi form is used as a mind/body intervention at Tufts Medical School to improve general health and specifically to prevent and treat osteoarthritis of the knee, its side effects and symptoms, as published in The BMJ (British Medical Journal), as well as for chronic pain/fibromyalgia prevention and treatment as published in the N.E. Journal of Medicine. Master-teacher Ramel Rones has witnessed first hand the profound long-term benefits of tai chi and qigong practice. Since 1989 he has been working to improve the lives of cancer and arthritis patients. He is a scientific consultant on mind/body therapies at Dana Farber Cancer Institute, Harvard Medical School, and Tufts School of Medicine, and co-author of scientific publications. See also Tai Chi P.M. Practice. 2022'] {'Genre': 'Exercise & Fitness, Special Interest, Faith & Spirituality', 'Format': 'DVD', 'Initial release date': '2021-12-17T08:00:00.000Z', 'Runtime': '3 hours and 40 minutes', 'Studio': 'YMAA Publication Center', 'Package Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.3 x 0.6 inches; 3.21 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'D0395', 'Media Format': 'DVD', 'Run time': '3 hours and 40 minutes'} I have to say, this is one of the best tai chi DVDs I’ve reviewed yet.
First of all, I want to speak to the price. It might seem high, but for what you get, I would say it’s an excellent value. It’s not one of those DVDs where you have one routine you do, and you just have to rewatch it over and over. This has three full length workouts, with each one set to two different types of music. Additionally, it has extremely detailed breakdown of postures and forms, so you can make sure you’re doing things correctly before entering the larger programs (terrific foundations!). The demonstrations are complete, with a breakdown of everything and why it needs to be the way it is; when the instructor has students, the modifications he does of their positioning is helpful, because it’s often times an adjustment you yourself need to make. He goes on to explain that these adjustments are to protect the knees or center balance, or allow for better flow of blood and energy.
As for the instructor, his background is impressive! He has worked with Harvard university and has a strong scientific background, so you can be sure that this practice is grounded in rigorous academic research, balancing ancient Chinese medicine with cutting edge science.
I highly recommend this DVD! I haven’t seen anything like this online or anywhere else. Scientifically grounded, detailed instruction; great value for a wide range of offerings Bundle: Daisy Lee 3-disc Beginner Qigong for Women (YMAA Qigong DVD) Radiant Lotus Qigong **BESTSELLER** Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Exercise & Fitness ['SALE! 3-DVD. Experience qigong with Daisy Lee with three different workouts.', '**BESTSELLER**. Complete collection. Qigong master Daisy Lee (as seen on Shift Network / GAIA) guides you through an easy series of healing qigong exercises for women in her bestselling 3-DVD series.', 'Qigong (energy cultivation) has been used for centuries to relieve stress, cultivate peace of mind, and improve health. These time-tested methods will rebalance your hormones and organ systems to help you to feel great.', 'Radiant Lotus Women’s Qigong', 'has helped thousands of women around the world to energize their immunity and vitality. Perfect for beginners and women at all stages of life, these follow-along routines are like a master class in your living room. The movements are simple to follow and can be done sitting or standing.', 'This 3-disc series includes: Shaking and Cupping for Enhanced Immunity Self-Massage to Release Stagnant Qi (energy) Tibetan Vibrational Sound Healing Anti-Aging Medical Qigong Series for Longevity 16-Movement Lotus Rises Through the Water Form Kwan Yin Closing Meditation and prayer Daisy Lee Interview', 'Radiant Lotus Women’s Qigong was created by Daisy Lee after years of study with several Qigong masters specializing in women’s health. \xa0This medical qigong supports holistic self-care and healing of menstrual and hormonal imbalances, benign breast and uterine tumors/cysts, fibrocystic breast disease, emotional ups and downs, menopausal symptoms, memory loss, and numerous other women’s health issues. Revitalize your radiant health and positive energy using these empowering self-healing tools with Master Daisy Lee. 3-DVD set. All regions / Region-free.'] {'Genre': 'Exercise & Fitness, Special Interest, Faith & Spirituality', 'Format': 'DVD', 'Initial release date': '2021-12-15T08:00:00.000Z', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Studio': 'YMAA Publication Center', 'Package Dimensions': '7.3 x 5 x 1.02 inches; 4.8 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'DVD', 'Run time': '2 hours and 15 minutes', 'Country of Origin': 'USA'} Featuring graceful, low impact movements, this qigong practice has a strong meditative emphasis, with beautiful, calming music and affirmations. While the definition isn’t as high as it could be, it’s not so important. What is important is the quality of the instruction, which includes information on which areas different exercises target, as well as notes for modifications if you have any injuries. The background is beautiful, and the verbal instructions are on a separate layer, which I think works better than other approaches where the instructor uses a microphone while doing the movement. This allows her audio to have a very calm quality that includes breathing and movement direction. I highly recommend this beginner friendly practice for women of all ages. It’s great for improving mobility, focus, and also for cultivating inner peace. Also, it’s a great value for the three DVDs that are included, with a menu that allows you to jump to specific exercises, or to run through the entire program.

The second and third DVDs have a slightly different approach, with the instructor working with a classroom of people. The exercises in the second one are not the ones you typically think of for qigong in the beginning, and instead focus on waking up the qi with shaking and bouncing and other exercises before then moving back to more typical movements. It also has a bonus section on acupressure points. The third DVD includes cupping and tapping techniques, which are invigorating and helpful for stress, and self massage.
Together, these three DVDs allow you to build a practice that is well balanced for a healthier, more peaceful life. NINE LEVELS, EASY TO EXPERT', 'The 8-hour Art and Science of Staff Fighting video offers complete step by step instruction for the staff, with an emphasis on the dynamics of combat. In advanced lessons, viewers learn disarming techniques, groundwork, and facing multiple opponents.', 'This video is not just for staff enthusiasts. Even those unfamiliar with martial arts can adapt these techniques, increasing their skill and confidence in defending themselves.', '"Our environment is usually full of improvised weapons,” says Varady. “Staff fighting techniques can be effectively applied in a self-defense situation using a walking stick, coatrack, curtain rod, floor lamp, hockey stick, fallen tree branch, broom, mop, shovel, or rake.”', 'This video features:', 'Nine levels, progressing from easy to expert Detailed step by step instructions, drills, fundamentals, and advanced techniques A “nondenominational” approach to staff, utilizing the best of Eastern and Western arts A comprehensive, methodical approach to building staff skills', 'If you are already a student of the staff, these lessons will augment your techniques, broaden your options, and offer foundational insights to other polearms such as the spear and halberd. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

The user continues to showcase a strong affinity for classic adaptations and traditional storytelling, particularly within the gothic horror genre, favoring narratives rich in historical detail. They appreciate indie films that explore love and relationships, especially those featuring strong female leads.

Recently, the user's enthusiasm for accessible fitness routines has deepened, notably through qigong practices tailored for women's health, aligning with their commitment to holistic wellness. Their engagement with martial arts also highlights their growing interest in diverse fitness disciplines, emphasizing techniques that enhance physical confidence and self-defense skills.

The user maintains progressive views on representation in media, positively engaging with narratives that champion diversity and inclusivity. They are discerning about adaptations yet recognize successful interpretations of source material.

An exciting recent interaction showcases the user’s embrace of uplifting narratives celebrating self-love and joy, particularly within diverse communities. Their focus on content that emphasizes positive messages and representation reflects their ongoing commitment to relatable themes in media.

Overall, the user embodies a balanced lifestyle, blending a passion for impactful cinema with a dedication to holistic fitness. They advocate for films and programs addressing sensitive themes, embodying humor and grace while exploring enriching experiences that integrate mind-body wellness with their cinematic interests, including a newfound appreciation for martial arts.
